benchmark_details.name: Breaking Language Barriers: Equitable Performance in Multilingual Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a new dataset of synthetic code-switched text derived from the CommonSenseQA dataset, aiming to improve performance in low-resource languages (LRLs) while maintaining high-resource language (HRL) performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To mitigate the performance gap in commonsense reasoning tasks between high-resource languages and low-resource languages through the development of synthetic code-switched datasets.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current evaluation is on a single language pair, Hindi-English.

data.source: Synthetic code-switched text derived from the CommonSenseQA dataset.
data.annotation: The data was generated using controlled language-mixing methods based on prompts applied to existing datasets.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated as the proportion of correctly answered questions out of the total number of questions in the test set.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of the LLM on the test dataset.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline model accuracy results shown in Table 1.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation methodology employed in experimental setup.
